meanings.definition: To make three times as much or as many
meanings.sent1: She trebled her savings by working extra hours.
meanings.sent2: The population of the town trebled in just a few years.
meanings.sent3: The baker trebled the amount of sugar in the cake by mistake.
meanings.sent4: His excitement trebled when he saw the surprise party waiting for him.
meanings.sent5: The storm trebled in intensity, shaking the windows with its force.

meanings.sent1: The company trebled its profits last quarter.
meanings.sent2: The number of attendees at the event trebled compared to last year.
meanings.sent3: The cat trebled its speed when it saw the mouse.
meanings.sent4: Her joy trebled as she watched her children play together.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of the freshly baked bread trebled, drawing in customers from afar.
